intro: Erigeron douglasii, commonly known as Douglas's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as meadows and rocky soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron douglasii is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
